decision_conditions: <p>The proposed increased ridge height and greater massing at first floor / roof level, with particular reference to the change in roof form on the eastern side of the application property, would create an unacceptable sense of enclosure to the detriment of the outlook at 244 Headstone Lane and their immediate garden areas. This would be contrary to Policy DM1 of Harrowâ€™s Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the relevant provisions of the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).<br></p>

<p>The new roof form, with particular reference to the
design, massing and proportions of its proposed front dormers, would be an overly
bulky and top heavy design that fails to integrate with the property overall and
the wider streetscene, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3&nbsp;of The
London Plan (2021), Policy CS.1B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1
of the Development Management Plan Local Policies (2013) and the adopted
Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>
description: Two storey front extension; first floor side extensions; single storey side extension; alterations and extension to roof to raise ridge height; three front dormers; rooflight in rear roofslope; external alterations
